name: Canada
description: Canada, the second-largest country in the world by total area, is a land of breathtaking diversity. From the rugged peaks of the Rocky Mountains to the vast expanse of the boreal forests, and the dramatic coastline of the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans, Canada offers an unparalleled range of landscapes and natural wonders. Its multicultural population and rich history contribute to a vibrant and dynamic nation.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Canada is the second-largest country in the world by total area.
quickFacts.detail: This vast territory encompasses diverse ecosystems, from arctic tundra to temperate rainforests.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Canada has a diverse population with a significant Indigenous presence.
quickFacts.detail: The population is concentrated along the southern border, with a growing presence in western provinces.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Ottawa is the political and administrative center of Canada.
quickFacts.detail: Located on the Ottawa River, it's known for its historic architecture and vibrant cultural scene.

quickFacts.label: Official Languages
quickFacts.description: Canada has two official languages, reflecting its multicultural heritage.
quickFacts.detail: French is predominantly spoken in Quebec, while English is dominant in most other provinces and territories.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, but generally stable.

quickFacts.label: Government
quickFacts.description: Canada operates under a parliamentary system.
quickFacts.detail: The Governor General represents the monarch, while the Prime Minister leads the government.

climateData.title: Canada's Climate Zones
climateData.description: Canada experiences a wide range of climates due to its vast size and latitude. From arctic conditions in the north to temperate climates in the south, Canada’s climate is incredibly diverse.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and pleasant temperatures prevail across much of Canada, with long daylight hours.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September-November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures and vibrant fall foliage, particularly in eastern Canada.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December-February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Canada experiences long, cold winters with significant snowfall, especially in the interior and northern regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March-May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings gradually warming temperatures and the return of wildlife, with melting snow and blooming flowers.

naturalWonders.name: Banff National Park
naturalWonders.description: Banff National Park is a stunning mountain landscape in the Canadian Rockies, renowned for its turquoise lakes, towering peaks, and abundant wildlife. It’s a popular destination for outdoor enthusiasts and offers breathtaking views at every turn.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in Alberta, Banff boasts iconic landmarks like Lake Louise and Moraine Lake. The park protects a diverse range of ecosystems, from alpine meadows to coniferous forests.

naturalWonders.name: Niagara Falls
naturalWonders.description: Niagara Falls is one of the world’s most famous waterfalls, straddling the border between Ontario, Canada, and New York, USA. The sheer power and beauty of the falls are a truly awe-inspiring sight.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The falls consist of three distinct waterfalls: Horseshoe Falls (the largest), American Falls, and Bridal Veil Falls. The surrounding area offers various attractions, including boat tours and observation decks.
viewingTips: Take advantage of the illuminated falls at night

naturalWonders.name: Cape Breton Highlands National Park
naturalWonders.description: Cape Breton Highlands National Park in Nova Scotia is a dramatic coastal landscape characterized by rugged cliffs, pristine beaches, and lush forests. It’s a haven for wildlife and offers stunning views of the Atlantic Ocean.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s Cabot Trail, a scenic highway, winds along the coastline, providing access to numerous hiking trails, viewpoints, and camping sites. It’s known for its red sandstone cliffs and diverse birdlife.

ecosystemData.title: Canadian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Canada’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from the Arctic tundra to the boreal forests and temperate rainforests. Each ecosystem supports a unique array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Canada is home to vast boreal and temperate forests, playing a crucial role in carbon sequestration and biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Arctic Tundra
biodiversityCategories.description: The Arctic tundra is a treeless landscape characterized by permafrost and short growing seasons.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Canada
activities.description: Canada offers a vast array of outdoor activities for all skill levels and interests, from hiking and camping to water sports and wildlife viewing.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Canada’s stunning trails and landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Coastal Trail Hike
activities.description: Hike along the rugged coastline, enjoying breathtaking ocean views.

activities.name: Mountain Trail Hike
activities.description: Challenge yourself with a hike through the Canadian Rockies.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, trekking poles, layers of clothing

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy Canada’s vast lakes and oceans with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Canoeing on Lake Louise
activities.description: Paddle across the turquoise waters of Lake Louise, surrounded by stunning mountain scenery.

activities.name: Whale Watching Tour
activities.description: Observe majestic whales in their natural habitat.
safety: Maintain a safe distance from the whales

clothing.winter: Warm layers, insulated jacket, waterproof boots, hat, gloves
clothing.yearRound: Versatile clothing that can be layered

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
